article: Several times on my way to work, I passed a gentleman who I supposed homeless.He had a lot of his possessions  _  down to his bike and held a cardboard sign that said he was a  _  who doesn't drink or do drugs, but would  _  anything that could be given.He usually has  _  on and is listening to the radio.He is always  _  his own business, often reading  as well  .I've never seen him  _  "begging". Several times, while I was  _  him, I realized I had some food with me, so I turned  _  and offered him that food.He took off his headphones, and said, "Umm, blueberry muffins are my  _  !" with a big smile and a gleam in his  _  .He thanked me so  _  . The graciousness and humbleness of his  _  makes me want to continue to stop by with "  _  " of food, money or other gifts.In the past, I've met  _  folks who  turned down  the food I was offering, saying that they wanted only money instead. So this wonderful gentleman being so open to receiving has been a  _  . It also makes me think how  _  I am to receiving in my life --- am I humble and grateful when I am  _  with something? Sometimes yes, sometimes no, but  _  as gracious, humble and sincere as this wonderful man has been in receiving.
